intro: Kedrostis crassirostrata, commonly known as the broad-beaked spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, spiny capsules. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, known for its diverse and often milky sap-containing species. Kedrostis crassirostrata is typically found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
